title: Ticket #7117: Add passwords.d and tokens.d to the packaging
description:
The packaging should create the following two directories:

  1. /etc/condor/passwords.d, owner root, mode 0700
  2. /etc/condor/tokens.d, owner root, mode 0700

These are the default location for passwords and tokens.
remarks:
2019-Jun-19 11:06:47 by tim:
For my HTCondor Week talk, you specified /etc/condor/password.d/POOL for the pool password. So, is it password.d or passwords.d?

2019-Jun-19 16:51:31 by bbockelm:
Ah, good catch. It is indeed passwords.d.

I double-checked the source: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/condor_utils/param_info.in#L2468-L2478

While I am at it:

  • /var/condor/credentials.d/krb 755 root:root
  • /var/condor/credentials.d/oauth 2770 root:condor
2020-Apr-10 07:46:13 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.

2020-May-02 23:48:11 by bbockelm:
This needs to be bounced back -- the OSG pool noted that TOKEN authentication stopped working after installing this update.

The tokens.d directory should be owned by user condor; with this change, it's owned by user root, breaking token auth for daemons.
